thread.title: Slideshow: FCIAC cross country championships at Waveny
thread.title_full: Slideshow: FCIAC cross country championships at Waveny

author: Dave Stewart
title: Slideshow: FCIAC cross country championships at Waveny
text:
To purchase photos from this slideshow, click here. 
The beauty of Waveny Park played host to one of the premier events of the fall athletic season when the FCIAC cross country championship was held on Wednesday. 
New Canaan’s teams fared well, with the girls taking six place in the team standings and the boys finishing 10th overall. 
The Ram girls placed two runners on the All-FCIAC Second Team, as junior Drew Davis was 24th and sophomore Cali Brannan was 29th. 
For the boys, junior Michael St. George led the way, finishing 37th overall. 
In the girls’ 4K race, the Ridgefield Tigers won the league crown after placing seven runners in the top 20. Staples’ senior Hannah DeBalsi, who will run at Stanford next year, won her third straight FCIAC title with a time of 14:05. 
The boys race was a 5K, with Danbury (71 points) edging Staples (74) for the championship. Senior Eric van der Els of Brien McMahon captured the individual title with a time of 15:24.
